review: I was previously using an Apple TV. While this is a fine device and I greatly appreciate being able to install 3rd party applications, I am disappointed by the UI. The home screen could be organized much better and I shouldn't have to go to Settings to find all of my installed applications. I understand that the idea is using your voice to find your apps, but this does not work if you have sideloaded apps or if you forget the name of the app. I'm still struggling configuring multiple game controllers. Again, I understand that many of the 3rd party apps are designed with a single touch interface in mind.

review: I've been using a Roku 2 for the past two years without issue but decided to try out AFTV.  The system runs very well but my only complaint  would be the missing portion for only my apps... Instead you see everything Amazon has available for the AFTV.  I'd rather search for the area rather than have it prominently displayed 24/7.

I tested the internet speed and it does not appear to be related to the internet unless, Comcast found a way to specifically block connections from Sling servers.
author: Amazon Shopper

review: I bought this last year. I stream Netflix, Hulu, YouTube, and Amazon Instant Video. This always quickly loads all of these. I bought my mom one of these for Christmas, and she likes it so much that she requested another one for Mother's Day. The Fire TV is so easy to use. My Dad, who has trouble using some technology can easily use it. I recomend this to anyone who likes to stream content off of the internet.
